channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytipping and BBQ, 30th June
item.description:
There has clearly been a BBQ and people have also flytipped big bags of litter and other things along this whole stretch of pavement behind the football pitch

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Houndsfield Road, Ponders End, London

item.title: Dead fox, 30th June
item.description:
A fox has been hit by a vehicle and its remains are in the middle of the road. It is outside 67b Croydon Road, not quite opposite the junction with Melvin Road. It must have happened overnight.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Melvin Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Between Mr Fish and property at 134 Brondesbury Rd right by the green BT street cabinet, 30th June
item.description:
Iâ€™d like to report a damaged nd pretty weathered green telecoms cabinet on the pavement next to Mr Fish/134 Brondesbury Rd. There is also a metal piece leaning against it and a significant amount of cigarette litter at its base. I believe the cabinet may belong to BT/Openreach, but I am bringing it to your attention in case it requires your coordination with the appropriate utility provider or action on the surrounding mess.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Salusbury Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
